channel.title: Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer
channel.description:
I found this computer on craig's list for only $75
Selling the Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer as pictured. Clean install of Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard, along with Microsoft Office. Computer works great, just needs a new home - no longer needed. Comes with a mouse, keyboard, and power cord. Was used in an office environment. Cash only, local pickup only. Specs: Dual 1 Ghz Motorola PowerPC G4 Processor 1.25 GB SDRAM 80 GB Hard drive Iomega Zip 250 Drive (Internal) Pioneer DVD-RW Drive (Internal) NVIDIA GeForce4 MX graphics card Ethernet Port 2 USB 1.1 Ports 2 Firewire 400 Ports Quicksilver - M8667LL/A - PowerMac3,5 - M8493 - 1896 PowerMac *This model is capable of booting Mac OS 9 and using Mac OS 9 applications within the Mac OS X "Classic" environment when used Mac OS X 10.4.11 "Tiger" and lower ("Classic" is not supported starting with Mac OS X 10.5 "Leopard"). This computer only has Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard installed. [img]http://images.craigslist.org/3G43I83Ne5F25J65M6d1g9a69a8eeac8b1d59.jpg[/img] [img]http://images.craigslist.org/3nf3m23Jf5K95H75Mbd1g07c47273ad051e86.jpg[/img] [img]http://images.craigslist.org/3E83Fb3He5Gb5Kf5Jdd1gafd969801e001d01.jpg[/img] [img]http://images.craigslist.org/3G53M53Fc5I15Ld5E9d1g88abf54a7d00190b.jpg[/img] [img]http://images.craigslist.org/3E23J53o55G15M85Jcd1g18717eb2ce3d12f3.jpg[/img] [img]http://images.craigslist.org/3Lc3I73Nd5L95Gb5E3d1g0a9b2d90994a16f1.jpg[/img]
Should I take advantage of this? I don't know anything about apple products so I can't tell if this is an 'old' mac or not..

item.title: Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

That’s too high. I bought a Powermac G5 for $105 just last year.

I think it’s a 2.0GHz with 1.5GB RAM

Read full topic
item.source: Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer

item.title: Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:478827”]They were made between 1999-2004.
Your pick mate.
On the upside, you can actually change parts out of this one. New macs don’t allow that.[/quote]
Do you think this is this comparable Windows XP?

Read full topic

item.title: Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

I found this computer on craig’s list for only $75

Selling the Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer as pictured. Clean install of Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard, along with Microsoft Office. Computer works great, just needs a new home - no longer needed. Comes with a mouse, keyboard, and power cord. Was used in an office environment. Cash only, local pickup only.

Specs:
Dual 1 Ghz Motorola PowerPC G4 Processor
1.25 GB SDRAM
80 GB Hard drive
Iomega Zip 250 Drive (Internal)
Pioneer DVD-RW Drive (Internal)
NVIDIA GeForce4 MX graphics card
Ethernet Port
2 USB 1.1 Ports
2 Firewire 400 Ports

Quicksilver - M8667LL/A - PowerMac3,5 - M8493 - 1896
PowerMac

*This model is capable of booting Mac OS 9 and using Mac OS 9 applications within the Mac OS X “Classic” environment when used Mac OS X 10.4.11 “Tiger” and lower (“Classic” is not supported starting with Mac OS X 10.5 “Leopard”). This computer only has Mac OS X 10.5 Leopard installed.





Should I take advantage of this? I don’t know anything about apple products so I can’t tell if this is an ‘old’ mac or not…

item.source: Apple Macintosh Power Mac G4 1.0 DP Desktop Computer
